title: Front Brake Caliper - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Do not allow a brake component to hang unsupported on the brake hose or line.
Brake hoses or lines that are not supported may become damaged or bent.
Bent or damaged brake hoses or lines lead to reduced braking efficiency causing loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Caution - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Note the orientation of brake hose to the front brake caliper for installation.
Disconnect the brake hose at the front brake caliper and place the free end of the hose in a suitable container to collect the brake fluid. Discard the two sealing washers.
Remove the brake caliper mounting fixings and slide the caliper off the brake disc.
If required, remove the brake pads (see
Repeat for the other brake caliper.
